With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

The Verdesian defines luxury, green living. At The Verdesian, our commitment to smarter living allows you to enjoy a healthier lifestyle while making a positive impact on our planet. Rising 26 stories, The Verdesian is the first LEED Platinum high-rise residential rental building in the nation and has become an important model for green construction around the world. Consisting of elegantly appointed studio- three bedroom homes, residences offer a blend of sophistication and sustainability. All environmentally sound apartments feature expansive layouts, naturally harvested building materials and innovative design features, providing abundant light, cleaner air, filtered water, and greater energy efficiency. 

Residents of The Verdesian enjoy unparalleled lifestyle services and amenities. Renovated Single-Family Townhouse with Turtle Bay Shared Gardens Access!

Home to iconic actress Katharine Hepburn throughout her long career (1931-1990s), this renovated single-family brownstone epitomizes New York elegance. Now you can join Katharine Hepburn, Bob Dylan, Stephen Sondheim, and E.B. White on the long list of New York artists and icons who have resided in the celebrity enclave surrounding Turtle Bay Gardens, a picturesque private park.

The interiors of this townhouse have been updated to meet contemporary standards of luxury while preserving their historic character. The kitchen and bathrooms have been renovated with custom stone tiling, top-of-the-line appliances, and stylish fixtures. Meanwhile, historic details remain, including graceful floor-to-ceiling windows, woodburning fireplaces, and ornate mantelpieces. Katharine Hepburn's original built-in mirrored vanity is a classic Hollywood touch.

Fall in love with this home's Italianate garden, complete with a Renaissance-style fountain. Then step out into Turtle Bay Gardens, a lush oasis that few New Yorkers are ever privileged to explore.

Garden Level:
The main entrance leads you into the stone-tiled foyer. On your left is a newly-renovated eat-in kitchen. With a stainless steel Sub-Zero refrigerator as well as a six-burner Viking range and double oven, this is truly a chef 's kitchen. The dining area includes a built-in breakfast table with benches. Passing through the butler's pantry with china cabinets and wine refrigerator, you reach the rear dining room. A wood-burning fireplace, wall sconces, and hardwood floors make this room warm and inviting. A wide set of windows give light while a glass door opens to the garden.

This garden is one of the most peaceful in New York. Dine on the multi-level flagstone patio among flowering shrubs and berry-laden bushes. Nearby, water burbles from the mouth of a carved stone fish embraced by a cheerful putto. After dinner, stroll in Turtle Bay Gardens, a private pocket park accessible only to residents of the surrounding townhouses. Rest momentarily on one of the garden's hidden benches before discovering one of several babbling Italiante fountains amid the abundant greenery.

Parlour Level:
Up the stairs you reach the parlour level, with extremely high ceilings and elegant details. The rear living room has floor-to-ceiling windows with period shutters, as well as a woodburning fireplace and carved wood mantelpiece. Pass through the butler's pantry, or through the hallway and down three graceful steps to the front parlour. This romantic room has a wood-burning fireplace and marble mantel, hardwood floors, and three floor-to-ceiling French doors leading to a Juliet balcony.

Third Floor:
This master suite is refined and spacious. The rear bedroom contains a wood-burning fireplace, hardwood floors and high ceilings. Three windows overlook verdant gardens; nearby, you can take advantage of Hepburn's mirrored vanity. The master bathroom is renovated to include a glass-walled shower as well as a claw-foot soaking tub and twin sinks. The front room could be a bedroom or library with an archway to a comfortable study.

Fourth Floor:
The front bedroom includes three tall windows, hardwood floors, and a renovated en suite bath with a glass shower and dressing room. The rear bedroom also includes an adjoining full bath with tub as well as a decorative fireplace.

Cellar Level:
This unfinished level houses the laundry room, as well as extensive storage space and building mechanicals.

55 Hope is a timeless nod to mid-20th century Brooklyn. Featuring unique loft living in a synthesis of classic architecture and modern amenities, residents can enjoy the sophistication of years past with the convenience of today. Carefully crafted interiors were created to highlight the original features of the building, including soaring, exposed concrete ceilings and large windows that frame the classic urban and Manhattan views. Wide plank oak floors, 8 foot solid core doors, white glass counter tops, imported Italian chef's kitchens with stainless steel appliances, Kohler fixtures and spa-like bathrooms with Zuma soaking tubs, Toto toilets and washer/dryers add a clean elegance to the charm of the warehouse details retained. Several units also feature home office spaces. 
55 Hope is not just a place to live its a lifestyle chosen by the discerning renter seeking distinct NY loft living with an elevated twist. Residents and guests are welcomed by a dramatic lobby lounge surrounded by bamboo gardens. Elevators grant residents ease of access to their lofts and the 8,500 SF landscaped roof deck offering panoramic views and opportunities to soak in the rays or relax with some outdoor yoga. A state of the art fitness center allows residents to stay fit. Bicycles and all other items may be stored in one of the many dedicated private storage spaces. 
Located in the midst of modish, New York City lifestyle, 55 Hope is within close proximity to four public playgrounds, three community gardens and some of Williamsburgs best known parks, including McCarren Park, which is popular for its concerts and festivals. Dozens of Zagat-rated restaurants decorate the neighborhood . While its difficult to imagine running out of spots to try in the neighborhood, the G (Metropolitan Ave) and L (Lorimer St) trains are each 3 blocks away, with the J, M, Z (Marcy Ave) station just a few blocks further.

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

 Life at 200 Water Street promises stunning city and waterfront views that take your breath away. This 32-story Emory Roth & Sons-designed building is best known for its oversized residences and iconic 50' high digital clock created by Rudolph de Harak.  Located across from the Seaport and steps from the chic eateries on quaint, cobblestoned Stone Street, 200 Water puts residents in immediate proximity of fine dining and shopping. The address is also two blocks from the Fulton Street transit hub and adjacent to the Financial District. Standing elegant and high, this unique statement of modern living is also a mainstay in the neighborhood. Originally built in 1971 as an office building, 200 Water was inspired by the principles of International Style of design championed by Philip Johnson, and was deliberately set back to allow for enhanced light and views.

Henry Hall is the first of its kind. A community destination like the boutique hotel you never want to leave or the members only club where everyones welcome.

Located as the former site of the Legacy Recording Studio, Henry Hall is redefining luxury for New Yorkers. The classic-yet-contemporary style of renowned designer Ken Fulk offers a unique getaway from the city. Each detail has been painstaking chosen to enrich the lives and residents alike. Oversized steel-encased windows and ash hardwood flooring throughout each apartment home. Stark white quartz countertops in the kitchen contrast upgraded stainless steel appliances and brass Waterworks fixtures for unique flair only found at Henry Hall. Impressive bathrooms feature hexagonal-tiled floors and floor to ceiling walls featuring custom subway tile with beautiful tiled moldings. Each residence will be outfitted with Amazons Dot featuring custom Henry Hall programming.

Residents can take advantage of an array of sought after amenities including a Jam Room, VIP Downtown Lounge, Residents Club Room, Roof Deck , Drawing Room with Private Dining Room and Chefs Kitchen, Wine Vault, and state- of-the- art training center as well and Henry Hall Concierge.

Located within New York's newest neighborhood, Hudson Yards, Henry Hall is just North of Meatpacking and Chelsea, adjacent to Hell's Kitchen and Midtown, stretching along the Highline providing stunning views of the Hudson River. Welcome home to 62 East 1st Street, a boutique, 10-unit, virtual doorman/elevator Condominium located in the heart of the East Village and providing all the essentials one could ask for in a residence.

Upon entering this renovated, thoughtfully considered apartment, you'll immediately notice the pin drop quiet and serene ambiance of the space. The well appointed kitchen is designed for fun and functionality as the breakfast bar welcomes an early morning coffee, or a place for guests to relax and socialize. The four burner Viking stove, Liebherr Refrigerator & Bosch Dishwasher make cooking and cleaning a joy while the mint condition caesarstone countertops tie the entire apartment together and give it a chic aesthetic often desired but rarely realized. 

Moving out to the private, 205 sq foot balcony, you'll appreciate that despite being in the center of the vibrant East Village neighborhood, you still have your exclusive sanctuary to take a breath. 

The fully renovated bathroom and Central A/C and Heat mean never having to stress about the basic comforts often lost in New York City living. With an in-unit washer/dryer, you'll never have to go outside unless you want to and the home office/guest room is a perfect complement to the apartment's impressive combination of form and function. 

The East Village, a lively, iconic Manhattan neighborhood with an adventurous spirit that defines downtown, will make you fall in love with its creative, gritty, and independent energy. Equal parts convenience and culture, it features hotspots like Russ and Daughters, the New Museum, and The Ludlow Hotel alongside staples like Union Market, and Whole Foods. If you do want to leave the neighborhood, you're steps from the F and 6 trains.

With a historic pedigree, a pulse on cultural trends, artistic roots and flourishing entertainment and nightlife: Williamsburg, Brooklyn has quickly become one of the most desired housing locations in the city. It is also the home to Heatherwood's luxury development: "544 Union"! Heatherwood firmly believes that a home should be a direct reflection of the sophisticated lifestyle of its resident. "544 Union" in Brooklyn NY combines clean architectural lines with open, bright floor plans to create a tranquil, stylish environment. Studio, 1 bedroom and 2 bedroom rental apartments comprise the 94-unit luxury low-rise. Exposed kitchens overlooking the main living area coupled with the façade sheathed with oversized windows give rise to bright, spacious apartments with exquisite natural light. All kitchens are equipped with gourmet stainless steel appliances and modern fixtures. 24-hour concierge service is available to all residents and our exemplary on-site maintenance staff is always there to help with any resident need. The abundant amenities found at 544 Union Williamsburg Brooklyn apartments afford residents both social and relaxation activities. The first floor resident lounge and game room are the perfect place to gather and relax with friends and neighbors. The large rooftop and second floor sun deck are fully furnished with large lounge chairs and high top tables for relaxing, socializing and getting some sun. The second floor sun deck also features a putting green, fire pit and cabanas. The state-of-the-art fitness center meets the needs of the most active resident. Equipped with the latest cardio and weight machines, as well as a separate yoga and stretching room. 544 Union apartments in Brooklyn NY is the perfect compliment to the Williamsburg, Brooklyn neighborhood; both offer resident’s style, an abundance of activities and convenience. Reside in Williamsburg’s newest Williamsburg Brooklyn luxury apartments and become immersed in the urban surroundings and beauty of Brooklyn.

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

Live at the iconic Essex House, a luxury Art Deco hotel with 185 privately owned residences now managed by J.W. Marriott. Built in 1931 as the largest and most luxurious hotel in Manhattan, it has been home to celebrities and captains of industry throughout the decades. Tenants are offered a full complement of white glove hotel services and world-class amenities including 24 hour in-room dining, valet, concierge and bell staff, a fitness center and spa, a business center and an award-winning restaurant. 
Rentals include weekly housekeeping (complete with bed and bath linens) as well as access to our fitness center and complimentary Wifi and cable. Here, all of your needs and wishes are met efficiently, with warm smiles.

The Chelsea Mercantile is the premier full-service building in the neighborhood. Amenities include a 24-hour doorman, valet, brand new lobby, gym, children's playroom, conference room, maid and dry cleaning services, and a fabulous roof deck with 360-degree city views. The building is located above Whole Foods and is one block away from most lines of public transportation servicing both the west and east sides of Manhattan. Outside, you will find the best of Chelsea, NoMad, and the Flatiron District. The building is moments from both the High Line and Madison Square Park.

The expansive, thoughtfully designed homes at The Helena are carefully appointed in high-end finishes including responsibly sourced wide-plank oak floors, kitchens fitted with Zodiac counters and optimized storage throughout. Many homes feature floor to ceiling windows with open city and river views.

The Helena offers a generous amenity package including a tri-story, state of the art health club serving daily grab and go breakfast, as well as a rooftop lawn and roof deck with BBQ grill. Additional amenities include shuttle service to Columbus Circle, storage, bike storage, on-site market and Restaurant, garage with plugs for hybrid vehicles, valet service and laundry on each floor.

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

* Listed rent is net effective rent, based on a gross rent of $3250.00 and 1 Month Free

Lifestyle:
* Sky Lounge: 
When you are ready to unwind, Rockwell offers the exclusive EOS Club. Members enjoy access to the Sky Lounge and Sky Deck showcasing a panoramic view of Downtown Brooklyn, the East River and the Manhattan Skyline. Indulge in the ambiance as the lounge music sets the mood against the glow of the two-way fireplace. After the sun sets the lounge becomes even more irresistible as the unique LED ceiling begins to come to life in color bringing the NY evening to life. 

* EOS Fit:
The EOS Gym features weekly classes which include, Yoga, Dance Fitness, Full Body Conditioning, Stretch and Core Strengthening and More, all from The Mark Morris Dance Group. In addition, Kickboxing classes are held by instructors from Brooklyn Martial Arts.

* EOS Play:
The game room offers a pool and an air hockey table, foosball tables and an Arcade room with classic video games all set to free play. 

* Zen Garden:
Members have access to large size BBQ grills, a dining table, ping pong tables and plenty of patio furniture which make this area feel like your suburban backyard. A large screening wall has been host to our popular summer movie nights. 

* EOS Community:
Only at Rockwell will you experience a social interactive community. EOS club events included events such as, Game Night and Entertainment, cooking classes, mixology, wellness events, happy hours, movie screenings and much more. 

* EOS Coffee Kiosk:
The coffee shop located in the EOS Lounge serves delicious coffees, espressos and teas from The Brooklyn Roasting Company. Text your order and our trained baristas will have your beverage of choice ready when you arrive. Members also have access to the clubs' bike share located right in front of Rockwell, reserved only for EOS members. The book club, sponsored by the beloved neighborhood Greenlight Book Store, welcomes new members.

36 Verandah Place is a spectacular renovated carriage house perfectly located on Cobble Hills Verandah Place, a quiet, mews lane and one of the most sought after blocks in Brooklyn. This 25 foot wide four-story brick home has 3,000sf of beautiful space and looks out on treasured Cobble Hill Park, offering wonderful spaces for entertaining, a spacious master bedroom floor, two additional bedrooms and a home office/nursery. The main floor comprises a large living room with two seating areas, windows to the north and south, a fireplace and a separate library. The south facing window overlook the homes magnificent multi-level garden. The garden level contains a full-floor open kitchen with oversized Calcutta marble island, extensive amounts of counter space and storage, and a spacious dining area in the huge bay window looking out to the garden. The kitchen also features a large brick fireplace, two sinks, a professional 6-burner Viking range with grill and double ovens, Subzero refrigerator, Bosch dishwasher, and wine refrigerator. Also included on this level: a full-size washer and dryer in a separate laundry room, a powder room, and a mechanical room (with updated systems including zoned central air conditioning). Access to the sunny tiered garden is off the kitchen, with a convenient patio for grilling and dining. The upper level garden houses a fantastic screened-in room for seasonal outdoor lounging and entertaining. The third floor features a large master suite with fireplace, en-suite windowed bath spanning the width of the house, with 2 large pedestal sinks plus separate tub and shower. The fourth floor consists of two spacious bedrooms, a wonderful built-in home office, and a full bath with a claw foot tub and skylight. This home is bathed in sunlight all day with a large skylight at the top of the stair well, and the wide landings on each floor give the home a wonderful sense of openness. Stepping out your front door onto magical Cobble Hill Park is a stunning way to greet the day, and the much beloved destination has food shops, boutiques restaurants of Cobble Hill, highly acclaimed schools and excellent transportation access are just moments away.

The Alfred Condominium is a luxurious, modern, full-service building. Services include 24-hour concierge, doorman, a dry-cleaning drop-off and a large package room. The health club has a well-equipped gym, a 75 foot lap pool, racquet ball court, sauna, steam room and Jacuzzi, all of which were recently renovated. With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

 World-renowned architect Bjarke Ingels breakthrough design puts an unconventional twist on the classic Manhattan residential building. Centered around the four core elements: Water, Energy, Air, and Earth VIA 57 WEST redefines green living with an unprecedented vision of sustainability that both respects nature and promotes well-being. The buildings dynamic architecture is reflected throughout the interiors that organically flow from indoor to outdoor living. Materials and construction have been carefully considered and selected for their resilience and environmental impact. Each aspect of the design has been thoughtfully planned to conserve water, reduce energy needs, and promote the wellness of residents while minimizing the impact on the environment.

 VIA 57 WEST offers premium rental residences that balance the excitement of the city and the tranquility of nature. Meeting the discerning needs of each individual, the building offers an array of studio, one, two, three, and four bedroom residences, many with expansive terraces overlooking the Hudson River or VIA Garden a 22,000 square foot lushly planted interior courtyard. A visual gateway to Manhattan, VIA 57 WEST, HELENA 57 WEST and FRANK 57 WEST are part of the 57 WEST residential superblock creating an oasis in one of New Yorks most dynamic cosmopolitan neighborhoods.

Newly Renovated Eco-Townhouse with Elevator on Prime Park Block

This sunny and stunning single-family home will dazzle you with its openness and luxury. Tall windows flood every floor with sunlight, and a double-height ceiling on the garden floor makes a striking impression. With four different outdoor spaces and a coveted location, this is a home that will bring you endless delight.

Baxt/Ingui, premier residential architects, have completed a breathtaking brand-new renovation, giving this house not only new splendor, but state-of-the-art systems. This is a passive house, which means it has been completely sealed against drafts. As a result, you have an ultra-efficient, ecologically sound home which takes less energy and money to keep warm, while keeping out noise and pests. A sophisticated ventilation system tempers the fresh air that constantly flows into the house. Triple-glazed windows are passive house certified and landmark approved, preserving both warmth and elegance.

Garden Level:
An entertaining or family room greets you as you enter from beneath the stoop. In the rear, youll find a kitchen with a grand double-height ceiling, floor-to-ceiling windows with garden views, a wine refrigerator, top-of-the-line appliances (Subzero, Wolf, and Gaggenau), seating at a large Caesar Stone center island, and plentiful storage. This floor also enjoys a powder room, and a walk-in closet that could be used as a pantry. The kitchen leads to the garden, your own oasis and connection to the earth.

Parlour Level:
Enter a grand living room with eleven-foot ceilings from a newly restored, historically accurate stoop, and take note of the Eco Hearth ethanol-burning fireplace. In the rear, youll find a light-filled dining room with its own back staircase down to the kitchen. The floor-to-ceiling windows that cover the back wall afford generous sunlight and beautiful garden views.

Third Floor:
This entire floor is devoted to the master suite. An enormous Bianco Carrara and Thassos marble master bath with a soaking tub occupies the front of this level, separated from the bedroom by two adjoining walk-in closets. The grand master bedroom features brand new white oak floors, a wet bar, and a secluded reading nook in the back, with copious sunlight flowing in through the glass that covers the back wall. French doors lead to your own private balcony overlooking the garden.

Fourth Floor:
Two bedrooms occupy this level, which could also be purposed as offices, studios, or dens. The front room has a wet bar, while the rear room leads out to a gorgeous private roof deck. Each room has its own closet and white oak floors. The two rooms share a Statuary marble full bath.

Fifth Floor:
This floor provides two more generous, full-sized bedrooms, each with white oak floors and their own full bath and closet. If you have children, there will be no arguing over who has a larger or better bedroom!

Roof:
This glassed-in roof deck will make an exquisite space for entertaining or just getting away from it all. Enjoy a glass of wine as you take in the neighborhood from the top of your building. As a bonus, its even accessible via the elevator!

Cellar Level:
With its high ceilings, this finished basement could easily be a rec room or a gym. It hosts a laundry room, a powder room, and brand-new mechanicals and electrics. Between the four inches of insulation and vapor barrier beneath the floor, and the multiple sump pumps, you have remarkable control of the climate and humidity; warmth stays in and moisture stays out.

21 West End is the pioneer luxury rental building in Lincoln Square. Located on West End Avenue between 60th and 61st Streets, 21 West End rises 48 stories above Lincoln Square. With striking views of the city skyline and Hudson River, the residences offer a wide range of studio to three bedroom layouts, designed by SLCE Architects. The amenities at 21 West End are unprecedented. A 24-hour concierge, bar and caf, dog park, playroom and workshop offer convenience to all residents. The fitness center includes over 60,000 SF of actively programmed exercise space, in addition to a yoga room, boxing studio and 60-foot indoor pool and spa. The building features ample entertaining space, including a lounge with outdoor terrace, club room, golf simulator, screening room, library and wine tasting room, plus more.

Now this is Bushwick!
Welcome to The Rheingold, the new standard of luxury living in Bushwick. No longer riding the coattails of its neighbors to the North & West, The Rheingold puts Bushwick on the map with a luxurious, resort style building. Occupying a full square block, on the site of the former Rheingold Brewery, this building features 500 units spread out amongst 8 floors.
The units were designed to maximize your living space and to provide the latest in comfort, design & technology. Large windows and open interiors allow for bright and cheerful layouts. Units are equipped with efficient cooling & heating systems, Built-In Bluetooth speakers and video intercom systems. Finished with wide-plank white oak flooring, designer tiles, high ceilings and ample closet space, the wide variety of floorplans means that there is something for everyone. Most units feature private outdoor space. Kitchens feature stainless steel appliances, soft-close glass cabinetry and sparkling porcelain backsplashes. The bathrooms are outfitted with deep-soaking tubs, sleek chrome fittings, beautiful tiles and medicine cabinets.
With over 70,000 square feet of outdoor space, 41 unique amenities, and a concierge service to handle all your needs, you may never have to leave the building. Work from home? If not, you may be tempted to start! The Rheingold offers a business center, conference rooms, laundry room, creative studios, fitness center and a scrumptious cafeteria. Grab a cup of coffee on your way to work or snack on a croissant as you work from the comfort of your urban oasis. Enjoy four seasons of NY weather in one of the large, landscaped outdoor spaces. Trees, flowers and fountains provide the backdrop on the lower courtyards. Excellent views of NYC, ample lounge space and waterfalls provide the zen factor on the common roofdeck. Test your fear of heights on the rooftop sky-bridge or on the climbing wall in the fitness center. Your four legged friends want to join in the fun? Bring them to the dog run or pet spa. Love to entertain? The building offers many areas that can be reserved for private events or parties including a music studio, photo studio, paint studio, movie screening room and private roof party area.
Home to some of Brooklyn’s best new restaurants, bars and nightlife, Bushwick offers all of the conveniences that NYC has to offer, right at your fingertips. You won’t have to go far for nightly entertainment, Bushwick is home to unrivaled arts, theater and music scenes, many located in former warehouses, a reminder of the neighborhood’s industrial past.
Getting around Brooklyn or into Manhattan is a breeze with the variety of convenient transportation options. Ditch those L train blues with the J/M/Z trains just minutes away at the Myrtle Avenue stop. The L train at Morgan Avenue is less than half mile away, the B57 is right around the corner & there is a Citi Bike station just a few blocks away.

Penthouse-level Flex 4-bed beauty in Downtown Brooklyn! 
This flexible 4 bedroom apartment is a contemporary dream: after a gut renovation in which no expense was spared, your new home is ready for you--all you need to do is bring your toothbrush! 
As you enter the apartment you're greeted with ample shoe storage & a deep entry closet. The great room welcomes you warmly with environmentally friendly yet durable bamboo floors and a breathtaking view of the Manhattan skyline, the East River & Downtown Brooklyn. The white Chef's kitchen boasts many modern conveniences--a 4 piece top-of-the-line stainless steel Viking appliance package with 5-burner stove/range (featuring a grill/griddle option), hidden-panel SS dishwasher, French Door fridge, & microwave hood, as well as an instant-boil faucet and Kohler professional sink. The stylish white gloss cabinets are complimented by the white quartz countertops & glass tile backsplash, and highlighted by undermount & recessed dimmable LED lighting. Storage space abounds in the numerous cabinets, pantry & broom closet. Not only is there plenty of room to sit at the bar-height countertop to enjoy a meal, but you also have a movable white quartz-topped adjustable height table that helps with extra prep space or a fantastic option for entertaining. 
The bathrooms are lined in Italian marble and replete with Toto fixtures: the main bath has a Toto deep soaking tub with rain shower head & wand and the master has a double-wide dual-head rain shower with wand as well as a heated towel rack. Both baths also feature mirrored deep medicine cabinets, floating vanities and Toto bidet toilet seats. 
Each bedroom enjoys generous natural light from the Northern & Western exposures and the 9 custom closets (many of which feature Efla storage solutions) will impress any urbanite. 
With features like motion-activated lighting and a modular pocket-wall that can turn the fourth bedroom into an office or dining area, this spectacular home was designed with discerning tastes in mind. A/Cs in each room and baseboard heating throughout will ensure you're comfortable in your new home year-round. Two dedicated & secure parking spots available for rent with the unit. 
Located on the 16th (top) floor of the first building of the University Towers complex [over 5 beautifully manicured acres], you'll lavish in the complex's amenities, which include 24-hour security/lobby attendants, package room, 24-hour fitness facility (for a nominal fee), newly renovated large laundry room off the lobby with modern card-operated wifi-enabled machines, secured on-site parking (two spots available to rent w/ unit), community room, bike racks, storage units (subject to availability), two live-in supers, an on-site management office, and a brand new BBQ area complete with four state-of-the-art gas grills & ample seating. 
University Towers is located at the nexus of the best that Brooklyn has to offer--in beautiful Fort Greene. bordering exciting Downtown Brooklyn. At your feet you'll have the DeKalb Avenue station which is the first stop in Brooklyn on numerous subway lines, as well as a quick stroll to over half-a-dozen other train lines. Within mere blocks you have the pristine beauty of Fort Greene Park (and its terrific farmers' market), the stunning architecture of the Fort Greene Historic District, the excitement of the BAM cultural district, the convenience of retail & entertainment at Barclays' Center/Fulton St mall/City Point (Trader Joe's, Target, Alamo Drafthouse, DeKalb Market, etc.), as well as some of the best restaurants & nightlife the borough can offer. 
This apartment is available January 15th (or as early as January 1, if furnished) or later dates also possible, furnished OR unfurnished. Board approval required. Standard broker's fee applies. Sorry, the NO PETS policy is strictly enforced.

240 Central Park South was built in 1941 and designed by Mayer & Whittlesey, each of the homes was carefully crafted to maximize light and air. Recognizing this extraordinary architecture, the property was designated an official New York City landmark and is the only fully restored landmark rental residence on Columbus Circle. 240 Central Park South features stunning units. a 24 hour concierge, a fitness center, as well as several shops, cafes and an award-winning restaurant. The building also offers a rooftop lounge and deck overlooking the park.

240 Central Park South sits at the crossroads of distinguished landmarks and vibrant neighborhoods with unrivaled proximity to Central Park and Columbus Circle. At your doorstep are the seasonal hues and great expanse of Central Park, award-winning restaurants, luxury retail and Broadway theaters. Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall and The Museum of Modern Art are just a few of the renowned institutions that call this neighborhood home. 240 Central Park South is located along ten different subway lines, providing convenient access to all of New York City.

We have a full variety of floor plans with everything from spacious studios up to expansive three bedroom homes. Each home has unique features: Some offer wood-burning fireplaces, unparalleled views of Central Park, washers and dryers and private terraces. Interiors are regularly fully renovated with modern designer kitchens and bathrooms.

Located at 100 West 31st Street, EOS offers distinctive residences, curated amenities, and the personalized service needed to engage New York City life to the fullest - inside and out. Premier recreation and relaxation facilities for residents to enjoy include a pool, fitness center on the lower level, as well as a game room and entertaining areas on the towers 47th floor with sweeping views of Manhattan. EOS offers 375 smoke-free rental residences consisting of studios, one, two, and two bedroom + den layouts. Each apartment contains a washer/dryer, dishwasher, hardwood floors, and kitchens and bathrooms with premium finishes and fixtures.

Consistent with The Durst Organizations ongoing commitment to sustainability, EOS offers residents a vision of sustainability that both respects the natural world and promotes your wellbeing. Centered around the four core elements - Water, Air, Earth, and Energy - EOS gives back to the environment and provides a home where people can thrive. Sustainable features have been woven throughout the building and each residence as an integral part of its design, construction and management.

Stepping out from inside EOS, some of the most desirable neighborhoods await. Electric NoMad, with its mix of restaurants, hotels, and boutiques, is at your doorstep. Stroll to Midtown, Bryant Park, the Flatiron District, Chelsea, and the Meatpacking District. EOS residents are also within a five-block walk to the following transit lines: 1, 2, 3, 6, B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, W, A, C, E, PATH, Amtrak trains, and various bus routes. EOS provides residents the best that New York City has to offer, both inside and out.

Come discover a neighborhood that immediately feels like home.

The windows alone in this apartment will steal your heart, but that’s just the beginning. This very special 3 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom apartment pairs warm materials with beautiful scale to create a true home in the most exciting rental building on the Upper East Side. With storybook views of trees from the neighboring townhouses to the West, and beautiful light coming through the oversized, double-glazed casement windows, there is a calm and welcoming atmosphere in this home. Just past the entrance foyer, with its generous coat closet and a perfectly placed powder room, is a 26 foot long living and dining room. The separate and spacious windowed PoggenPohhl kitchen, is both beautiful and functional, with Caesarstone countertops and backsplash, an integrated state-of-the-art Liebbher refrigerator, Bosch appliances, a hood that vents to the outside, a wine refrigerator, and an Insinkerator garbage disposal. The large and tranquil corner master bedroom has three big casement windows, easily fits a king bed and has a walk-in-closet the size of a small room. The en-suite, windowed master bathroom features a custom marble mosaic floor, a glass enclosed shower, a double walnut vanity with Caesarstone countertops, mirrored medicine cabinets, and built in storage. The two secondary bedrooms are generous in size and share a lovely bathroom with marble floors and a Waterworks cast iron tub. The secondary bedroom wing can be closed off from the living space with solid wood pocket doors for privacy when entertaining. There is also a washing machine and vented dryer in the apartment.

Located on a charming tree-lined block, 245 East 78th Street is a historic building that has been reimagined as a boutique collection of twenty-two modern apartments. The classic and detailed pre-war façade has been carefully preserved and restored, while double-glazed European casement windows have been added for optimal natural light and architectural richness. Aside from the exterior, everything in the building has been completely gut renovated. Residents will enjoy all new systems such as individually controlled multi-zone heating and cooling, Insinkerator garbage disposals, washer/dryers that vent and hardwood floors. Amenities include an attended lobby with a full time doorman and a package room for deliveries, a landscaped roof terrace with open city views, a private fitness center with a walkout courtyard, a bicycle room, and a private storage closet for each residence. With an ambiance that resembles a wonderful boutique hotel, 245 East 78th Street raises the bar for apartments on the Upper East Side. Pets are welcome.

Enjoy the suburbs of Brooklyn in this 3 bed 1.5 bath apartment in Mill Basin. Featuring an updated bathroom and kitchen, and ample closet space. 240 Central Park South was built in 1941 and designed by Mayer & Whittlesey, each of the homes was carefully crafted to maximize light and air. Recognizing this extraordinary architecture, the property was designated an official New York City landmark and is the only fully restored landmark rental residence on Columbus Circle. 240 Central Park South features stunning units. a 24 hour concierge, a fitness center, as well as several shops, cafes and an award-winning restaurant. The building also offers a rooftop lounge and deck overlooking the park.

240 Central Park South sits at the crossroads of distinguished landmarks and vibrant neighborhoods with unrivaled proximity to Central Park and Columbus Circle. At your doorstep are the seasonal hues and great expanse of Central Park, award-winning restaurants, luxury retail and Broadway theaters. Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall and The Museum of Modern Art are just a few of the renowned institutions that call this neighborhood home. 240 Central Park South is located along ten different subway lines, providing convenient access to all of New York City.

 World-renowned architect Bjarke Ingels breakthrough design puts an unconventional twist on the classic Manhattan residential building. Centered around the four core elements: Water, Energy, Air, and Earth VIA 57 WEST redefines green living with an unprecedented vision of sustainability that both respects nature and promotes well-being. The buildings dynamic architecture is reflected throughout the interiors that organically flow from indoor to outdoor living. Materials and construction have been carefully considered and selected for their resilience and environmental impact. Each aspect of the design has been thoughtfully planned to conserve water, reduce energy needs, and promote the wellness of residents while minimizing the impact on the environment.

 VIA 57 WEST offers premium rental residences that balance the excitement of the city and the tranquility of nature. Meeting the discerning needs of each individual, the building offers an array of studio, one, two, three, and four bedroom residences, many with expansive terraces overlooking the Hudson River or VIA Garden a 22,000 square foot lushly planted interior courtyard. A visual gateway to Manhattan, VIA 57 WEST, HELENA 57 WEST and FRANK 57 WEST are part of the 57 WEST residential superblock creating an oasis in one of New Yorks most dynamic cosmopolitan neighborhoods.

Welcome home to this unique New Development at 160 Leroy Street by Ian Schrager and designed by Herzog & de Meuron, with Three Bedrooms and Three and Half Bathrooms in approx.. 2,351 square feet and 11 foot ceiling heights offering direct River, City & Park Views with Southern and Western exposures. Impeccably designed for the modern lifestyle, the residence's open floor plan accommodates outstanding living and entertaining, while maximizing light and abundance of wall space for art. 

An unmatched Living Room on the waterfront flows gracefully into the dining area and Opened Eat-in Kitchen by Bulthaup with Scandinavian Larch wood cabinets and hand selected Sivec marble slab countertops and backsplash. All the appliances are fully integrated including a Sub-Zero refrigerator, Wolf oven, Gaggenau cooktop and Miele dishwasher. 

The Kitchen is complemented by a professional enclosed Chef's Kitchen; a modern, rethought European-style larder for everyday use complete with a Sub-Zero freezer and wine refrigerator, Wolf steam oven, microwave oven and integrated Wolf coffee/espresso machine. The gracious Master Bedroom suite has open west views, oversized dressing area, and a lavish spa master bath with a deep Kaldewei soaking tub, radiant heated floors, double Sivec marble vanity, large stall shower, and spacious water closet, all clad in slabs of pure Sivec marble. The Second and Third bedrooms have custom en-suite bathrooms with Sivec marble mosaic tilled walls, and custom vanities with integrated Corian sinks. The powder room is clad in floor to ceiling Scandinavian larch wood and has a custom floating Sivec marble vanity. This home also features a professionally designed laundry room with a deep sink and large capacity washer/dryer. 

Featuring 12 inch wide-plank imported Scandinavian Larch wood floors throughout; oversized 11 foot floor-to-ceiling windows; prewired for AV; Dimming system; Motorized shades; Triple custom pane curtain wall with UVB/UVA protected glass. 

160 Leroy offers 57 one of a kind residences with extensive amenities that includes a private cobblestone driveway, lush, landscaped park by Madison Cox, professional spa with 70-foot pool above ground, whirlpool, fitness center, yoga/pilates studio, steam room, sauna, massage room, Club house with catering kitchen and a children's play room. 160 Leroy is situated on a cobblestone street in the heart of the West Village and is conveniently located across from The Hudson River Park and bike paths, steps to The Highline Park, Meatpacking District, home of the Whitney Museum, fabled Bleecker Street, and some of the city's best shopping and restaurants.

Now this is Bushwick!
Welcome to The Rheingold, the new standard of luxury living in Bushwick. No longer riding the coattails of its neighbors to the North & West, The Rheingold puts Bushwick on the map with a luxurious, resort style building. Occupying a full square block, on the site of the former Rheingold Brewery, this building features 500 units spread out amongst 8 floors.
The units were designed to maximize your living space and to provide the latest in comfort, design & technology. Large windows and open interiors allow for bright and cheerful layouts. Units are equipped with efficient cooling & heating systems, Built-In Bluetooth speakers and video intercom systems. Finished with wide-plank white oak flooring, designer tiles, high ceilings and ample closet space, the wide variety of floorplans means that there is something for everyone. Most units feature private outdoor space. Kitchens feature stainless steel appliances, soft-close glass cabinetry and sparkling porcelain backsplashes. The bathrooms are outfitted with deep-soaking tubs, sleek chrome fittings, beautiful tiles and medicine cabinets.
With over 70,000 square feet of outdoor space, 41 unique amenities, and a concierge service to handle all your needs, you may never have to leave the building. Work from home? If not, you may be tempted to start! The Rheingold offers a business center, conference rooms, laundry room, creative studios, fitness center and a scrumptious cafeteria. Grab a cup of coffee on your way to work or snack on a croissant as you work from the comfort of your urban oasis. Enjoy four seasons of NY weather in one of the large, landscaped outdoor spaces. Trees, flowers and fountains provide the backdrop on the lower courtyards. Excellent views of NYC, ample lounge space and waterfalls provide the zen factor on the common roofdeck. Test your fear of heights on the rooftop sky-bridge or on the climbing wall in the fitness center. Your four legged friends want to join in the fun? Bring them to the dog run or pet spa. Love to entertain? The building offers many areas that can be reserved for private events or parties including a music studio, photo studio, paint studio, movie screening room and private roof party area.
Home to some of Brooklyn’s best new restaurants, bars and nightlife, Bushwick offers all of the conveniences that NYC has to offer, right at your fingertips. You won’t have to go far for nightly entertainment, Bushwick is home to unrivaled arts, theater and music scenes, many located in former warehouses, a reminder of the neighborhood’s industrial past.
Getting around Brooklyn or into Manhattan is a breeze with the variety of convenient transportation options. Ditch those L train blues with the J/M/Z trains just minutes away at the Myrtle Avenue stop. The L train at Morgan Avenue is less than half mile away, the B57 is right around the corner & there is a Citi Bike station just a few blocks away.

Inside you'll find a totally renovated apartment with matte finish, polished oak parquet floors, sliding mirrored closet doors, a designer bathroom with smoke gray floor tiles, a floating Ceasar stone vanity, classic subway tiles with smoke gray finishing. The full sized kitchen as framed by beautiful french doors and features Cesar Stone counter tops, stainless steel appliances and matching mini subway tiles and smoke gray floor tiles. A large bay window and two side windows let plenty of sunlight in and there's room for a Queen or even a King sized bed with plenty of room left over for a living room and dining set. There's an on-site superintendent and a card operated laundry center in the basement. 

This World Class neighborhood features famous restaurants and bar lounges like the Palm Restaurants, Sparks Steakhouse, PJ Clarkes, Smith & Wollensky and is minutes from popular stores such as Bloomingdales, Whole Foods, Morton Williams & Gristedes. Not to mention the convenience of the most famous transportation hub of them allGrand Central Terminal where you can catch the Shuttle to Times Square or the 4,5,6,7 trains and all the Metro-North trains plus Express Buses to Queens, Staten Island, Brooklyn & the Bronx plus the LIRR extension which is on its way.

Head just down the street and visit with diplomats and citizens of the world at the United Nations, get some organic fruits and veggies each Wednesday at the Farmers Market at Dag Hammarskjold Plaza Park, watch the flowers blooming in the Katherine Hepburn Garden, catch a Japanese art exhibit at the Japan Society or maybe take a relaxing swim at the Vanderbilt YMCA or Equinox gym or grab a drink and a bite on 2nd Avenues restaurant row all just steps from your prize purchase.

Coming sometime in the future and for the 1st time in 60 years, there will be a waterfront promenade with seating benches and a bike path right behind the UN. Don't believe it? Well, no one ever believed the 2nd Ave Subway would become a reality either. So come to be a part of the revitalization of one of NYC's quietly sophisticated and undervalued neighborhoodsMidtown East Turtle Bay, before the secret is out!

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

240 Central Park South was built in 1941 and designed by Mayer & Whittlesey, each of the homes was carefully crafted to maximize light and air. The building also offers a rooftop lounge and deck overlooking the park.

240 Central Park South sits at the crossroads of distinguished landmarks and vibrant neighborhoods with unrivaled proximity to Central Park and Columbus Circle. At your doorstep are the seasonal hues and great expanse of Central Park, award-winning restaurants, luxury retail and Broadway theaters. Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall and The Museum of Modern Art are just a few of the renowned institutions that call this neighborhood home. 240 Central Park South is located along ten different subway lines, providing convenient access to all of New York City.

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

Whether you seek a new adventure at Governor's Island or like to people watch on the quaint cobblestone block of Stone Street, this is the neighborhood for you.

240 Central Park South was built in 1941 and designed by Mayer & Whittlesey, each of the homes was carefully crafted to maximize light and air. Recognizing this extraordinary architecture, the property was designated an official New York City landmark and is the only fully restored landmark rental residence on Columbus Circle. 240 Central Park South features stunning units. a 24 hour concierge, a fitness center, as well as several shops, cafes and an award-winning restaurant. The building also offers a rooftop lounge and deck overlooking the park.

240 Central Park South sits at the crossroads of distinguished landmarks and vibrant neighborhoods with unrivaled proximity to Central Park and Columbus Circle. At your doorstep are the seasonal hues and great expanse of Central Park, award-winning restaurants, luxury retail and Broadway theaters. Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall and The Museum of Modern Art are just a few of the renowned institutions that call this neighborhood home. 240 Central Park South is located along ten different subway lines, providing convenient access to all of New York City.

Welcome to 72nd Street between 4th & 5th avenue in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn a historical block with a row of 1900s town-homes with oodles of detail. Whether its the short 3-block distance from the train stop on Bay Ridge Avenue or 77th Street, or the beautifully lined townhomes complemented by the tree-lined block, the few minute commute will be like no other, once you reach your future nest. 

Renovated duplex home with gorgeous details in prime Bay Ridge. This one of a kind townhome is offering 3.5 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, modern open concept, exclusive backyard patio/garden and onsite laundry. The elegant home promises ample space and regal style, in large part due to the millwork, solid mahogany doors, crown moldings, decorative fireplace mantles, built in armoire and the refinished oak hardwood flooring throughout the home. 

On the first floor: The spacious living room boasts three double-hung windows, millwork throughout which give the home much character. The spacious living room opens up into the dining room and eat -in kitchen via french doors. The modern kitchen features white cabinetry topped with a natural stone, stainless steel appliances including a dishwasher and a hood range. A full bathroom and 3 large closets are located on this floor. Access to your exclusive backyard. Laundry room with cabinets.

On the second floor: Three bedrooms await you on the second floor. One bedroom can easily accommodate a California king sized bedroom which leads to a bonus room. The second bedroom can accommodate a king/queen sized bedroom set, and the smaller of the three can fit a full sized bedroom set. The sunshine light floods through the bedroom windows ensuring an uplifting glow in every corner. Angled oak wooden floors run throughout the bedrooms and into 3 spacious closets on this floor. The modern full sized bathroom is completely up to date featuring; a vanity, a tub, marble tiling, and modern fixtures. 

Experience the excitement of living in Brooklyn, without the hassle and stress of inner-city life. A vast array of bars, cafes, restaurants and shops are in immediate walking distance from your new residence, but the R train is just steps away, and is easy transportation for any further destinations! Enjoy a walk to the Shore Road, or take a ride by the Verrazano Bridge to Coney Island. Whatever you choose to do, you will adore Bay Ridges beautiful views, chilled out vibe, and abundance of good food. You'll never want to leave once you've nuzzled up to this lovely little corner of Brooklyn.

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

 This furnished apartment is located in Midtown West, also known as Hell's Kitchen. It is one of the city's most iconic neighborhoods. Home to the bright lights of Times Square and Broadway, the area is constantly buzzing with activity. Along Restaurant Row diners can find a wide variety of flavors to please the extremely diverse crowds. There are countless options to satisfy any craving at any time of day. Midtown West offers serene strolls along the Hudson River, perfect for spending time outdoors on a sunny day. The pier mainly consists of sightseeing boats, which offer a unique way to experience the city. Close by are the relaxing corners of Bryant Park and the New York Public Library. The Midtown West area is easily accessible by public transport. Historic Grand Central Station is only a 20 minute walk away.

Located at 100 West 31st Street, EOS offers distinctive residences, curated amenities, and the personalized service needed to engage New York City life to the fullest - inside and out. Premier recreation and relaxation facilities for residents to enjoy include a pool, fitness center on the lower level, as well as a game room and entertaining areas on the towers 47th floor with sweeping views of Manhattan. EOS offers 375 smoke-free rental residences consisting of studios, one, two, and two bedroom + den layouts. Each apartment contains a washer/dryer, dishwasher, hardwood floors, and kitchens and bathrooms with premium finishes and fixtures.

Consistent with The Durst Organizations ongoing commitment to sustainability, EOS offers residents a vision of sustainability that both respects the natural world and promotes your wellbeing. Centered around the four core elements - Water, Air, Earth, and Energy - EOS gives back to the environment and provides a home where people can thrive. Sustainable features have been woven throughout the building and each residence as an integral part of its design, construction and management.

Stepping out from inside EOS, some of the most desirable neighborhoods await. Electric NoMad, with its mix of restaurants, hotels, and boutiques, is at your doorstep. Stroll to Midtown, Bryant Park, the Flatiron District, Chelsea, and the Meatpacking District. EOS residents are also within a five-block walk to the following transit lines: 1, 2, 3, 6, B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, W, A, C, E, PATH, Amtrak trains, and various bus routes. EOS provides residents the best that New York City has to offer, both inside and out.

Come discover a neighborhood that immediately feels like home.
